result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Allesandro Boelter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 2, 4 & 6.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than Friday March 25, 2016 12:00 p.m.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 9 days credit if revoked.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$160.00 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 7 Case #15CF463.
$1200.00 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 7 Case #15CF463.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 7 Case #15CF463.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 7 Case #15CF463.
Parties may argue court costs in writing within 10 days.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Attend MRT Program or any other cognitive therapy. To be determined by Agent.
-Court permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
With credit for good time.
Court grants Huber for work/seek work at the determination of the Huber Officer.

Court costs and restitution to be converted into a civil judgment.
Payment plan to be set up once Defendant is released from Jail.

DE called stating his atty notified him that he hasn't been making his pymts. DE was advised that he is current until 2/11/20 & that this info is also viewable online. From DE requesting to make pymt in person on 7-12-19. Ret'd call to DE & approved his pymt to be pd on 7-12-19. DE stated he gets off work @ 3 pm, will cash his paycheck, & will make the pymt online by midnight. DE is approved to do so. jaf

From DE on 6-21-19 @ 8:44 am re: pymt (msg was difficult to understand). Ret'd call to DE today & DE stated he was unable to get the remaining $20, but did just recently obtain a new job. DE to submit a req for deferment of the remaining $20 for his June pymt by 4 pm on 6-27-19. DE was given the info required on his req, the fax #, & stated he would fax it tomrw. jaf

DE appeared to request to make a partial pymt for his June pymt stating that he is working thru a Temp Agency & does not have work @ this time. DE is approved to pay the remaining $20 by 4 pm on 6-21-19 or he must call the Pymt Clerk for instructions to submit a request to reduce pymt. DE stated he will attempt to make the $20, but will call if need be. DE also inquired about him possibly having to serve jail time for a Pierce County case. DE was advised that he will need to submit a request to have his Pymt Plan deferred if jail time is ordered. jaf

From DE on 5-13-19 @ 2 pm stating he was supposed to make pymt today, but doesn't have his ID to cash his ck. DE called again today stating he made his pymt after 11 pm last night & wanted to verify that we rec'd it. DE was advised that I do not see a pymt nor did I see a confirmation page awaiting receipt.  DE stated he was having issues w/his ph last night & will just come in to make pymt.  DE is approved to make his pymt in person today. jaf
DE called to request an ext for his pymt due on the 11th.  DE is approved to make his pymt by 4 pm on 5-13-19, but was reminded to make his pymts on or before his due date going fwd. jaf

DE called at 8:05 am stating he couldn't get his pymt in yest as he was working.  DE was reminded that we have 24 hr pymt options & that pymts are expected on or before the due date.  DE stated he is attempting to have direct deposit set up thru his employer & will make pymt in person today by 4 pm.  jaf

From DE on 4-09-19 @ 1:35 pm stating he has questions about his Pymt Plan.  DE called again today to request an ext stating he doesn't get pd until 4-15-19.  DE is approved to make his pymt by 4 pm on 4-15-19, but was reminded to have his pymts in on or before the 11th of ea mo going fwd. jaf

From DE on 3-11-19 stating he has questions about pymt.  Ret'd call to DE today & advised him that I do see he was able to make pymt.  DE stated he was just inquiring if pymt could be made over the phone, but he's now aware he'll need to utilize GPNet.  DE also inquired about making pymt early & was advised that his next pymt is due 4-11-19 & if he were to make pymt early, it will be applied to his Apr pymt.  jaf

DE called to inquire when his Pymt Plan begins stating his Pymt Plan Agmt is filed away.  DE was advised that his 1st pymt of $40 is due by 3-11-19 & by the 11th of ea mo thereafter until pd in full.  DE was asked if he needed his case # to make pymt & stated he has his copy of the agmt & will retrieve it when his pymt is due.  jaf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Marcus Allesandro Boelter appeared. Case called at 4:16 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for plea and sentencing. ADA Minser files an amended information. ADA Minser recites recommendations. Requesting restitution in the amount of $4,610.00 joint and several with Anthony Boelter in 15CF462. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 7 Theft Movable Property per the amended information in 15CF463. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 7 Theft Movable Property per the amended information in 15CF463. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 2, 4, 6 and read in for restitution purposes only. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file an appeal. Crt orders:

-  S/W 2 years probation. Report to probation no later that noon on Friday, March 25, 2016. DE able to serve probation in Minnesota. Bond will remain until reports to probation. 9 day jail credit of probation is revoked.

-    Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 

-    DNA Sample

-    Court costs in the amount of $268.00 and $250.00 DNA Surcharge. To be paid over the course of probation. Parties may argue court costs in writing within 10 days

-    Attend MRT program or any other cognitive therapy. TO BE DETERMINED BY THE PROBATION AGENT

-    AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-     Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

-     May apply for expungement if successfully completes probation

-    Restitution is ordered but will be held open for a restitution hearing

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF463 and 15CF462:

Interstate Compact for Juveniles signed by RMW this date. eif
Arraignment at 10-23-2015 02:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brandon C., Briann R., Sharla L., Eric R. or their residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF462 and 15CF463:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber  and Atty T Gregory Amann DF:  Anthony D. Boelter appeared from jail and Marcus Boelter appeard from jail. Case called at 9:20 a.m. ADA Minser calls Elizabeth Posel to the stand. S/T Elizabeth Posel. Direct by ADA Minser. Witness identifies defendant's in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification of defendant's. No questions by Atty Weber. Cross by Atty Amann. Witness excused. ADA Minser calls Ryan Miller to the stand. S/T Ryan Miller. Direct by ADA Minser. Cross by Atty Weber. Cross by Atty Amann. Witness excused. No further witnesses by parties. Atty Weber gives argument. Atty Amann gives argument. ADA Minser gives argument and asking for court to find probable cause. Court at this time finds that there is probable cause and binds defendant's over for trial. ADA Minser requesting to schedule arraignment. ADA Minser states there is a warrant for the defendant's in MN. Court has a form that is titled Interstate Compact for Juveniles. Anthony Boelter has waived any and all rights to challenge Minnesota's request and will accept the waiver and voluntary consent to return to MN. Marcus Boelter has waived any and all rights to challenge Minnesota's request and will accept the waiver and voluntary consent to return to MN. Court will sign . Court will modify bond to a $1,000 signature bond with the same non monetary conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Appointing Atty Amann. km

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
